docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
The Madevo Assistant REST API provides programmatic access to the Madevo AI assistant platform. It enables developers and partners to authenticate users, interact with AI assistants through conversational sessions, and ingest structured data into Madevo data sources for analysis, automation, and reporting.

The API is designed around REST principles and uses JSON for all request and response payloads.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text:
Development environment https://dev.madevo.ai/api/v1

Production environment https://app.madevo.ai/api/v1

All endpoint paths described in this documentation should be appended to the selected base URL.

docs.title: Authentication Overview
docs.text:
The Madevo Assistant API uses token based authentication. Clients must authenticate using an email address and password to obtain an access token. This token must be included in the Authorization header for all protected endpoints.

Authentication flow:

  1. Authenticate with email and password to obtain an access token
  2. Include the token in the Authorization header for API requests
  3. Refresh the token when it expires to maintain access

docs.title: Core Capabilities
docs.text:
The API provides the following main capabilities:

  • Secure user authentication and token refresh
  • Conversational interaction with AI assistants
  • Persistent, context aware conversations
  • Structured data ingestion into Madevo data sources
  • Support for visual and structured assistant outputs

docs.title: Request Format
docs.text:
• All requests must use HTTPS
  • Request and response bodies are formatted as JSON
  • Content-Type should be set to application/json

docs.title: Authorization Header
docs.text:
All protected endpoints require the following header:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

powershell Copy code

docs.title: Timestamps
docs.text:
Where applicable, timestamps should be provided in ISO 8601 format using UTC.

Example:

2025-01-01T12:00:00Z

csharp Copy code

docs.title: Environments
docs.text: Environment Base URL Development https://dev.madevo.ai/api/v1 Production https://app.madevo.ai/api/v1

docs.title: Versioning
docs.text:
The current version of the API is v1. Backwards incompatible changes will be introduced in future versions and documented accordingly.

Clients are encouraged to pin integrations to a specific API version.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
To get started with the Madevo Assistant API:

  1. Obtain valid login credentials
  2. Authenticate using the login endpoint to receive an access token
  3. Use the assistant chat endpoint to interact with an AI assistant
  4. Push structured data to a data source if required

Detailed examples for each endpoint are provided in the following sections of this documentation.

docs.title: Support
docs.text: If you encounter issues or have questions about the API, please contact the Madevo team or your designated technical contact.

docs.title: Assistant Interaction
docs.text: The Assistant Interaction API allows clients to communicate with a Madevo AI assistant using natural language. Messages are exchanged within a conversation context, enabling the assistant to maintain memory, understand intent, and provide context aware responses.

docs.title: Send Message to Assistant
docs.text: Send a user message to the AI assistant and receive a generated response.

docs.title: Endpoint
docs.text: POST /restapi/assistant/chat

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: This endpoint requires authentication.

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN Content-Type: application/json

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
{
  "conversation_id": "12345",
  "message": "Hello, assistant!",
  "skip_history": false,
  "skip_save_history": false
}

docs.title: Request Parameters
docs.text: Field Type Required Description conversation_id string Yes Unique identifier for the conversation message string Yes User message sent to the assistant skip_history boolean No Ignore previous conversation history skip_save_history boolean No Do not store the message and response

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "message": "Hello! How can I assist you today?",
  "visualization": {}
}

docs.title: Response Fields
docs.text: Field Type Description message string Assistant generated response visualization object Optional structured output for UI rendering

docs.title: Conversation ID
docs.text:
The conversation_id groups messages into a single conversational session. Reusing the same conversation_id allows the assistant to maintain context across multiple interactions.

Typical use cases include:

  • Follow up questions
  • Clarifications
  • Multi step reasoning
  • Progressive exploration of data

Providing a new conversation_id starts a new conversation.

docs.title: skip_history
docs.text:
When set to true, the assistant ignores all previous messages in the conversation and responds only to the current message.

This is useful for:

  • Stateless queries
  • One off questions
  • Debugging

docs.title: skip_save_history
docs.text:
When set to true, the current message and response are not persisted.

This is useful for:

  • Sensitive requests
  • Temporary or exploratory queries
  • Privacy focused workflows

docs.title: Example Request
docs.text:
{
  "conversation_id": "network-ops-001",
  "message": "What was the average temperature yesterday?",
  "skip_history": false,
  "skip_save_history": false
}

docs.title: Example Response
docs.text:
{
  "message": "The average temperature yesterday was 21.4°C.",
  "visualization": {
    "type": "line_chart",
    "data": [
      { "time": "00:00", "value": 20.1 },
      { "time": "06:00", "value": 20.8 },
      { "time": "12:00", "value": 22.3 },
      { "time": "18:00", "value": 22.4 }
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text:
Status Code Meaning 400 Invalid request payload 401 Unauthorized or invalid token 403 Forbidden 500 Internal server error

Error responses may include a descriptive message to assist debugging.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Reuse conversation_id for follow up interactions
  • Be clear and specific in user messages
  • Store access tokens securely
  • Refresh tokens before expiration

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Assistant behaviour may vary based on connected data sources and permissions
  • Visualization formats may evolve over time
  • Responses are generated dynamically and may differ for similar prompts

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: The Madevo Assistant API uses token based authentication. All protected endpoints require a valid access token.

docs.title: Authentication Flow
docs.text:
1. Authenticate using email and password
  2. Receive an access token
  3. Include the token in the Authorization header
  4. Refresh the token when it expires

docs.title: Login
docs.text: Authenticate a user and obtain an access token.

docs.title: Endpoint
docs.text: POST /restapi/login

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Content-Type: application/json

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
{
  "email": "user@example.com",
  "password": "yourpassword"
}

docs.title: Request Parameters
docs.text: Field Type Required Description email string Yes User email address password string Yes User password

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "token": "your_access_token"
}

docs.title: Response Fields
docs.text: Field Type Description token string Access token used for authenticated requests

docs.title: Refresh Token
docs.text: Generate a new access token using an existing valid or recently expired token.

docs.title: Endpoint
docs.text: POST /restapi/refresh-token

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN Content-Type: application/json

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text: {}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "token": "new_access_token"
}

docs.title: Using the Access Token
docs.text:
Include the access token in the Authorization header for all protected endpoints.

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

docs.title: Token Behaviour
docs.text:
• Tokens have a limited lifetime
  • Expired tokens return a 401 response
  • Refresh tokens before or after expiration
  • Replace the old token after refreshing

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text:
Status Code Meaning 400 Invalid request payload 401 Unauthorized or invalid credentials 403 Forbidden 500 Internal server error

Error responses may include a descriptive message to assist debugging.

docs.title: Security Best Practices
docs.text:
• Never expose passwords in frontend code
  • Store tokens securely
  • Always use HTTPS
  • Avoid logging authentication data

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Token lifetime and behaviour may change in future API versions
  • Authentication requirements depend on user permissions

docs.title: Data Ingestion
docs.text: The Data Ingestion API allows clients to push structured data into a Madevo data source. This data can then be queried, analyzed, or used by AI assistants and agents within the Madevo platform.

docs.title: Push Data to Data Source
docs.text: Insert one or more records into a specified data source.

docs.title: Endpoint
docs.text: POST /restapi/datasource/insert

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text: This endpoint requires authentication.

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN Content-Type: application/json

docs.title: Request Body
docs.text:
{
  "datasource_id": "67890",
  "data": [
    {
      "timestamp": "2025-01-01T12:00:00Z",
      "metric": "temperature",
      "value": 22.5
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Request Parameters
docs.text: Field Type Required Description datasource_id string Yes Identifier of the target data source data array Yes Array of records to insert

docs.title: Data Format Guidelines
docs.text:
• Records must be valid JSON objects
  • All records in a request should follow the same schema
  • Timestamps should use ISO 8601 format in UTC
  • Numeric values should use standard number types

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "message": "Data successfully inserted"
}

docs.title: Response Fields
docs.text: Field Type Description message string Confirmation of successful insertion

docs.title: Batch Insertion
docs.text:
The API supports inserting multiple records in a single request.

Example:

{
  "datasource_id": "67890",
  "data": [
    { "timestamp": "2025-01-01T10:00:00Z", "value": 21.2 },
    { "timestamp": "2025-01-01T11:00:00Z", "value": 21.9 },
    { "timestamp": "2025-01-01T12:00:00Z", "value": 22.5 }
  ]
}

docs.title: Error Responses
docs.text:
Status Code Meaning 400 Invalid request payload 401 Unauthorized or invalid token 403 Forbidden 500 Internal server error

Error responses may include a descriptive message to assist debugging.

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
• Validate data before sending
  • Use consistent schemas per data source
  • Batch records when possible to improve performance
  • Monitor error responses during ingestion

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Data validation rules depend on the configured data source
  • Large payloads may be subject to size limits
  • Ingestion behaviour may evolve in future API versions

docs.title: Errors and Status Codes
docs.text: The Madevo Assistant REST API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate whether a request was successful or resulted in an error. Error responses are designed to be clear and consistent to help clients diagnose issues quickly.

docs.title: Success Responses
docs.text: Status Code Meaning 200 Request completed successfully

docs.title: Client Errors
docs.text:
Client errors indicate that the request was invalid or could not be processed as sent.

Status Code Meaning 400 Bad request. The request payload or parameters are invalid 401 Unauthorized. Missing, expired, or invalid access token 403 Forbidden. The client does not have permission to access the resource 404 Not found. The requested endpoint or resource does not exist

docs.title: Server Errors
docs.text:
Server errors indicate that the request was valid but could not be processed due to an internal issue.

Status Code Meaning 500 Internal server error 502 Bad gateway 503 Service unavailable

docs.title: Error Response Format
docs.text:
When an error occurs, the API may return a JSON response describing the issue.

Example:

{
  "error": "Unauthorized",
  "message": "Invalid or expired access token"
}

docs.title: Invalid Authentication Token
docs.text:
• Access token is missing
  • Access token has expired
  • Access token is malformed

Resolution: Authenticate again or refresh the token.

docs.title: Invalid Request Payload
docs.text:
• Required fields are missing
  • Field types are incorrect
  • JSON payload is malformed

Resolution: Validate the request body against the endpoint documentation.

docs.title: Permission Denied
docs.text:
• User does not have access to the requested resource
  • Action is not allowed for the current role

Resolution: Verify user permissions or contact the Madevo team.

docs.title: Best Practices for Error Handling
docs.text:
• Always check HTTP status codes
  • Handle 401 responses by refreshing the access token
  • Log error responses for troubleshooting
  • Avoid retrying requests that return 4xx errors without modification

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Error messages may vary depending on the endpoint
  • Additional error details may be added in future API versions ```
